cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the northwestern Bahamas, then forecast to run very close to and parallel the Florida east coast before curving north-northwest toward Georgia/South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore the east-central Florida coast close to West Palm Beach–Cape Canaveral corridor

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach to South Santee River, South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC (including Lake Okeechobee)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast from Miami-Dade northward, continuing into Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained hurricane-force winds with gusts over 100 mph as the western eyewall grazes the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the Palm Beach County shoreline, higher if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with localized amounts up to 12 inches, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, destructive surf and rip currents; hazardous seas hampering vessel operations and channel access.
